availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Rodolphus B. Ratliff (Caldwell County, KY, gunsmith, farmer, and sheriff)

body.p: Princeton, Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary J. Knight Ratliff on April 16, 1846 in Bullitt County. Father of Albert Ratliff, George Ratliff, Charlie Ratliff, Willie Ratliff, J. H. Ratliff, and L. E. Ratliff. Owned four enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Gunsmith in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860. Sheriff of Caldwell County in 1862.
